meanings.definition: Misstops (verb): to make a mistake or error in judgment
meanings.sent1: She often misstops when trying to solve math problems.
meanings.sent2: He misstops by choosing the wrong path in the maze.
meanings.sent3: The detective misstops and accuses the wrong person.
meanings.sent4: His misstops led him to a dead end in his career.
meanings.sent5: Misstops in navigation can lead to getting lost in the woods.

meanings.definition: Misstops (noun): plural form of misstop, meaning a mistake or error in judgment
meanings.sent1: The misstops made by the team cost them the game.
meanings.sent2: Learning from past misstops can help avoid future errors.
meanings.sent3: The comedy of errors was filled with misstops and misunderstandings.
meanings.sent4: Her misstops were like stumbling blocks on the path to success.
meanings.sent5: The book highlighted the misstops of the main character throughout the story.

meanings.definition: Misstops (adjective): describing something that is mistaken or incorrect
meanings.sent1: The misstops decision led to a lot of confusion.
meanings.sent2: She realized her misstops assumption after getting more information.
meanings.sent3: The misstops report caused chaos in the office.
meanings.sent4: His misstops belief prevented him from seeing the truth.
meanings.sent5: The misstops directions on the map led them astray.
